solution_line_template: Since Peter reads three times as fast as Kristin, Kristin will take {peter_read_time_per_book}*{speed_multiplier} = <<{peter_read_time_per_book}*{speed_multiplier}={kristin_time_per_book}>>{kristin_time_per_book} hours to read one book.
Kristin reads half of her books, a total of {total_books_kristin}/{half_divisor} = <<{total_books_kristin}/{half_divisor}={kristin_books_to_read}>>{kristin_books_to_read} books.
The time Kristin will take to read half of her books is {kristin_books_to_read}*{kristin_time_per_book} = <<{kristin_books_to_read}*{kristin_time_per_book}={total_time_kristin}>>{total_time_kristin}
